  • Device Communication
  • POST /message/:network[/:device]

POST /message/:network[/:device]

https://http.cloud.tiny-mesh.com/v2/message/:network[/:device]
200 OK – Returns the newly created message object  (formated as per query parameters).
400 Bad Request – Fails with a error object when there was an error in the input.
401 Unauthorized – Returns a error object
403 Forbidden – Fails with a error object. The error itself will describe ACL violation (access to device, network etc)

URL Parameters

  • :network – The key of the network resource
  • :device – An optional key used to specify the device  the message should be sent to. If the parameter is not used the message payload must define the target address (ie. using the proto/tm.uid field).

Query Parameters

  • ack – Force acknowledgement flag for multi-cast commands. This flag only have an effect when a) message in question is a command, b) no proto/tm.cmd_number have not been set in the payload, c) the device using firmware X.XX
  • data.encoding – Specifies the encoding of binary data fields (like proto/tm.data for serial data events). The value can be either base64, hex or binary. Data encoding may also be set by the X-Data-Encoding header, if both header and query parameter option is used the header will have higher priority.

Request Headers

  • X-Data-Encoding – Specifies the encoding of binary data fields, can be either base64, hex or binary. Data encoding may also be set by the data.encoding query parameter. If both header and query parameter option is used the header will have higher priority.

Description

Specifies the encoding of binary data fields, can be either base64, hex or binary. Data encoding may also be set by the data.encoding query parameter. If both header and query parameter option is used the header will have higher priority.

Creates a single message for the target specified by :device or as identified from the parameter proto/tm.uid.

Format of the message varies but each message contains the fields  key, datetime, received and  proto/tm. The exact format of the message are described in the message resource page
